titleStmt.title: Long Parliament-vvork, (if they wil please to do't) for the good of the Common-Wealth: or, The humble desires of the well-affected, revived. Tender'd to the most serious consideration of the Parliament, Army, and others, in XX. proposals, concerning I. Liberty of conscience. ... XX. About hospitalls and alms-houses.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by T.L. for G. Calvert, at the Black-Spread-Eagle, neer the west-end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: The words "I. Liberty .. alms-houses." are bracketed together on title page, with "concerning" reading up at left.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the Black-Spread-Eagle, neer the west-end of Pauls
